Description.val: Handles the Range, Locate, Sort and Print Data internal events

Comment.val: This component provides an interface for the user to perform Range, Locate, Sort and Print Data.The component does not expose any object. It has logic units for handling the Range, Locate, Sort and Print Data internal events.The source code for this component is available in the Add_On\UserFunctionality directory, so you can customize the screens of the component as you wish.

It has logic units for handling the Range, Locate, Sort and Print Data internal events.The source code for this component is available in the Add_On\UserFunctionality directory, so you can customize the screens of the component as you wish.

Text.val: SHA-256 for Magic variable Alphanumeric (ANSI)
SHA-256 for Magic variable Blob (Binary)
SHA-256 for Magic variable Blob (ANSI)

ExpSyntax.val: 'Franz jagt im komplett verwahrlosten Taxi quer durch Bayern'
UnicodeToANSI ('Franz jagt im komplett verwahrlosten Taxi quer durch Bayern', 65000)
UnicodeToANSI(Trim('Franz jagt im komplett verwahrlosten Taxi quer durch Bayern'), 65000)
'For AES Keylength needs to be ' & Trim(Str(E*8,'')) & ' Bits. Either enter a Key with that length or derive one from a passphrase'

Text.val: Allows user to input password/passphrase and derives an encryption key from that information
The key will encoded with hexdigits

Text.valUnicode: Enter here your encryption password/passphrase. The program will create an AES key from it which is used for encryption

AES works with fixed keylength of 16 (default), 24 or 32 Bytes. That does however not mean that the passwors/passphrases which you doi use for AES have to have exactly that length. This program will derive the encryption key from your password/passphrase (and also encode it to hexdigits so that its easier to store and transport it). The IV value required for some encryption modes is generated from random data and encoded with hexdigits as well.

Text.val: In table ecb_e_m we have (some of) the test vectors from NIST
Thats's the Monte Carlo Encryption Tests for ECB Mode with varying key sizes
All the values stored in this file (resp. our database table) are hexencoded
@DESC: Program encrypts plaintext (arbitrary data) with AES algorithm and specified mode of operation
It uses Magic Cipher function to achieve this
Get binary data from the parameters which are expected to be encoded with hexdigits ...
Successful encryption as it looks. Read Ciphertext from temp. file and delete it immediately after ..
ERROR: Temp. File with encryption result empty or access failure ...
HEXDIGITS is default and mgcrypt_AES_Encrypt already produces ciphertext in hexadecimal representation
ERROR: Unsupported output encoding ..

ExpSyntax.val: H=0 AND L<>'' AND FileExist(L) AND FileSize(L)>0

Text.val: Get binary data from the parameters which are expected to be encoded with hexdigits ...
Successful decryption as it looks. Read Plaintext from temp. file and delete it immediately after ..
ERROR: Temp. File with encryption result empty or access failure ...

ExpSyntax.val: G=0 AND J<>'' AND FileExist(J) AND FileSize(J)>0

Text.val: @DESC: Program encrypts plaintext (arbitrary data) with AES algorithm and specified mode of operation
It uses Magic Cipher function to achieve this
Get binary data from the parameters which are expected to be encoded with hexdigits ...

STP.TXT: Magic Cipher failed to treturn a value

Text.val: AES has 16 Bytes as default for some properties (keylength, ...)
decode hexencoded data to blob binary
since we have a problem with Blob parameters having 0 characters in the middle
we use function mgcrypt_HexdecodeToFile() which will decode to a temporary file.
We then read the content of that file in our Blob parameter and delete it.
